subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Suitability of the OED for pronunciation checking (was: something else)
msgSnippet: ... Alas, it is still true.  The OED3 is a work in progress, and only about a third of the existing entries have been updated so far. -- By Elbereth and
messageBody:
dipartite scripsit:

> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, John Cowan <cowan@...> wrote:
> > The OED, though great for history, can't be safely used for pronunciation:
> > too many of its pronunciations are a hundred years old and more.
>
> This applies to an old public-domain version of the text, right?
>
> I'd hope this isn't true of the OED 3rd ed., (© 2010 and 2012) that
> ships with OS X Mavericks

Alas, it is still true. The OED3 is a work in progress, and only about
a third of the existing entries have been updated so far.

--
By Elbereth and Luthien the Fair, you shall cowan@...
have neither the Ring nor me! --Frodo http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
